title: Design Thinking-Based Liberatory Pedagogy Workshop for Higher Education Professional Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic design thinking processes and professional work experience
context.additional_context: A course focused on strengthening the ability to solve social problems through design thinking and cultivating critical analysis of power structures, targeting professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields.

learning_goals: Learners can design social problem-solving scenarios for professional domains with 80% accuracy by applying the four-stage design thinking process.
Learners can iteratively improve prototypes reflecting stakeholder perspectives three or more times using collaboration tools.
Learners can analyze data collected from design thinking activities and write a critical evaluation report (approx. 1,000 characters) on existing power structures.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
